intro: Cryptandra exserta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. Cryptandra exserta is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
